item.title: 巴基斯坦空气污染致数百人入院
item.description: 巴基斯坦大城市拉合尔当地政府表示，由于空气污染，一天之内已有 900 多人入院治疗。【原文：More than 900 people have been admitted to hospital in a single day in the Pakistani megacity of Lahore due to air pollution, the local government said.】

item.title: 创纪录的 2024 年气温首次突破 1.5 摄氏度的巴黎目标
item.description: 根据欧盟的一项数据服务，今年将是有记录以来最热的一年，也是第一个超过 2015 年巴黎气候大会设定的目标的年份。【原文：This year will be the hottest on record, and the first to exceed the target set at the Paris climate conference in 2015, according to a European Union data service.】

item.title: 锂市场低迷，Albemarle 将裁员
item.description: Albemarle 公司计划将其全球员工人数削减 6%-7%，作为在锂价格下滑和需求放缓的情况下降低成本的努力的一部分。【原文：Albemarle Corp. plans to cut its global workforce by 6%-7% as part of efforts to reduce costs as lithium prices slump and demand slows.】

item.title: 由于减记和预测令人失望，SolarEdge 跌幅超过 20
item.description: SolarEdge Technologies Inc.股价暴跌超过 20%，此前这家太阳能设备制造商减记了 10 亿美元，并警告称本季度的利润率将不复存在，甚至为负值。【原文：SolarEdge Technologies Inc.’s shares plunged more than 20% after the solar-equipment maker took a $1 billion writedown and warned margins for the current quarter will be non-existent or even negative.】

item.title: 狂风肆虐加利福尼亚州，野火导致马里布高速公路关闭
item.description: 由于消防员正在应对强干风引发的野火，马里布的太平洋海岸公路已被关闭。【原文：The Pacific Coast Highway is closed in Malibu as firefighters respond to a wildfire driven by powerful dry winds.】

item.title: 伯克利选民否决对建筑物使用天然气征税
item.description: 加利福尼亚州具有气候意识的伯克利是美国第一个试图禁止在新建建筑中使用天然气的城市，该市的选民们全面否决了一项对天然气征税的措施。【原文：Voters in climate-conscious Berkeley, California — the first US city to attempt a ban on natural gas use in new buildings — roundly rejected a measure that would have imposed a tax on the fuel.】

item.title: 对冲基金徘徊不前，特朗普胜选引发 ESG "膝跳式 "大跌
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得大选后的几个小时里，几乎没有什么资产类别能像与环境、社会和治理（ESG）相关的资产类别那样遭受如此沉重的打击。【原文：Few asset classes suffered as painful a blow in the hours after Donald Trump’s election victory as those associated with ESG.】

item.title: 中国太阳能电池板巨头天合光能将出售位于得克萨斯州的工厂
item.description: 中国可再生能源巨头天合光能公司（Trina Solar Co.【原文：China’s renewables giant Trina Solar Co. has agreed to sell its US solar manufacturing operations amid increased American scrutiny of Chinese companies benefiting from clean energy tax incentives created under President Joe Biden’s signature climate law.】

item.title: 华盛顿州投票决定继续征收本拟废除的碳税
item.description:
包括英国石油公司（BP）、亚马逊（Amazon）和微软（Microsoft ）在内的公司与环保组织联手挫败了终止该州限额交易计划的提案。【原文：

Companies including BP, Amazon and Microsoft joined with environmental groups to defeat a proposal to end the state’s cap-and-trade program.

】

item.title: 南达科他州将废除输油管法律，对美国乙醇造成打击
item.description: 一条耗资 89 亿美元的碳捕集管道提案使美国玉米带出现两极分化，该提案在至关重要的南达科他州再次受挫。【原文：A proposed $8.9-billion carbon-capture pipeline that has polarized the US Corn Belt has hit another setback in the critical state of South Dakota.】

item.title: 拉斐尔飓风将以三级大风暴袭击古巴
item.description: 周三晚些时候，飓风拉斐尔将以三级大风肆虐古巴海岸，然后穿过这个岛国，进入墨西哥湾。【原文：Hurricane Rafael will rake Cuba’s coast with Category 3 winds later Wednesday before it crosses the island nation and emerges into the Gulf of Mexico, weakened but on a track that could threaten the US or Mexico.】

item.title: 特朗普的胜利对气候意味着什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普当选美国第 47 任总统，在美国历史上最两极分化的白宫竞选中实现了惊人的政治逆袭。您可在此阅读彭博社的持续报道。【原文：Donald Trump has been elected the 47th president of the United States, pulling off a stunning political comeback in one of the most polarized contests for the White House in US history. You can read Bloomberg’s continuing coverage here.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，杰富瑞告诉 ESG 老板与律师保持密切联系
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）成为美国总统大选的赢家之后，人们敦促环境、社会和治理基金经理与他们的律师保持密切联系。【原文：ESG fund managers are being urged to keep their lawyers very close, after Donald Trump emerged as the winner of the US presidential race.】

item.title: 从石油到电动汽车，特朗普的胜利对能源意味着什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的胜利有望撼动美国的能源和环境政策，对石油生产、海上风能开发和电动汽车销售产生深远影响。【原文：Donald Trump’s victory promises to shake up US energy and environmental policy, with sweeping implications for oil production, offshore wind development and electric vehicle sales.】

item.title: 特朗普有望赢得美国大选，绿色能源股下挫
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选将意味着美国很可能会优先考虑化石燃料而非可再生能源，风能企业的股价周三大幅下挫。【原文：Shares in wind energy firms plunged on Wednesday as a presidential victory for Donald Trump would mean that the US will likely prioritize fossil fuels over renewables.】

item.title: 随着野火风险的增加，PG&E 公司切断了对加州客户的供电
item.description: PG&E 公司关闭了北加州近 25,000 个家庭和企业的电源，因为迪亚波罗狂风和骤降的湿度增加了野火的风险。【原文：PG&E Corp. shut off power to nearly 25,000 homes and businesses in Northern California as gusty Diablo winds and plummeting humidity levels raise the risk of wildfires.】

item.title: 恶劣天气使菲律宾农业产量降至 2020 年以来最低水平
item.description: 受恶劣天气影响，菲律宾上一季度的农业产量创下近四年来的最大降幅，显示出亚洲增长最快的经济体之一的增长可能受到拖累。【原文：The Philippines’ farm output dropped the most in nearly four years last quarter due to bad weather, showing a potential drag to growth in one of Asia’s fastest-expanding economies.】

item.title: 南非 85 年来首次在 11 月下雪
item.description: 据南非国家气象局称，南非本周在 11 月迎来了 85 年来首次大雪，而在这个季节，夏天即将来临。【原文：South Africa this week had its first major snowfall in November, a time of year when summer is approaching, in 85 years, according to the national weather service.】

item.title: 全球最大的钴矿产商对电动汽车金属的未来持悲观态度
item.description: 世界第一大钴矿产商对金属在电动汽车电池中的作用日益缩小敲响了警钟。【原文：The world’s No. 1 cobalt miner is sounding the alarm over the shrinking role of the metal in electric vehicle batteries.】

item.title: 飓风 "拉斐尔 "威胁佛罗里达礁岛群，正向美湾袭来
item.description: 拉斐尔在墨西哥湾肆虐时变成了飓风，有可能对从开曼群岛到南佛罗里达的人口密集地区造成破坏性狂风和暴雨。【原文：Rafael became a hurricane while churning toward the Gulf of Mexico, threatening to inflict damaging winds and heavy rains on populated areas from the Cayman Islands to South Florida.】

item.title: 摩根大通警告峰会停止后产品将 "瘫痪
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is cautioning against inaction after a summit intended to steer more private finance toward protecting biodiversity ended in limbo.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚国家石油公司称波哥大面临 "结构性 "缺水问题
item.description: 古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）总统说，由于缺水，波哥大正在进入一个 "结构性问题"，导致首都恢复了严格的配给制度。【原文：President Gustavo Petro said that Bogotá is entering a “structural problem” due to water shortages that have led the capital to reinstate strict rationing.】

item.title: 美国例外论，现在有了更多石油
item.description: 美国人今天将前往投票站，虽然总统候选人对美国在应对气候变化方面的作用有着极为不同的看法，但他们都在争夺领导一个目前世界第一大石油生产国的位置。今天的通讯将探讨这将如何影响美国在国际气候谈判中的信誉。【原文：Americans are heading to the polls today, and while the presidential candidates have extremely different views on the US’s role in combating climate change, they are vying to lead a country that is now the world’s No. 1 producer of oil. Today’s newsletter looks at how this impacts the credibility of the US at international climate negotiations.】

item.title: 桑切斯称西班牙面临 106 亿欧元洪灾损失账单风险
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）宣布了首个针对该国东部瓦伦西亚地区因风暴造成 200 多人死亡的灾民的一揽子财政计划。【原文：Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced the first financial package for victims of the storms that killed more than 200 people in the country’s eastern region of Valencia.】

item.title: 全球 GDP 遭受的气候打击远比最初担心的要大
item.description: 气候变化造成的经济损失可能比以前担心的要严重得多，因为新的数据为用于预测最可能结果的模型提供了信息。【原文：The economic cost of climate change will likely be much more severe than previously feared, as fresh data informs models used to predict the most probable outcomes.】

item.title: 头号石油生产国能否引领气候问题？美国正在尝试
item.description:
最新的美国例外论是，美国的石油出口量比沙特阿拉伯高出50%，同时还试图推动全球实现净零排放。【原文：

The latest in American exceptionalism is exporting 50% more oil than Saudi Arabia while trying to prod the world towards net zero.

】

item.title: 大麻产业必将发展壮大，对环境的影响也是如此
item.description:
随着杂草在四个州被列入选票，该行业正日益被迫面对其能源、水和土地使用问题。【原文：

With weed on the ballot in four states, the industry is increasingly being forced to confront its energy, water and land use.

】

item.title: 事实上的禁令解除后，耗资 2 亿英镑的英国风电场计划重新启动
item.description: Cubico 可持续投资公司计划投资 2 亿英镑（约合 2.6 亿美元）在英格兰建造最大的陆上风力发电厂，今年早些时候，英国新一届工党政府结束了对此类开发项目的暂停。【原文：Cubico Sustainable Investments plans to invest £200 million ($260 million) to build the largest onshore wind farm in England, after the UK’s new Labour government ended a hiatus for such developments earlier this year.】

item.title: 维斯塔斯全年利润预计为指导范围的下限
item.description: 维斯塔斯风力系统公司（Vestas Wind Systems A/S）表示，预计全年盈利将在预期范围的下限，这家风力涡轮机制造商正努力在可再生能源领域长期动荡之后安抚投资者。【原文：Vestas Wind Systems A/S said it expects earnings for the full year at the lower end of its expected range as the wind turbine maker seeks to reassure investors after a prolonged period of tumult in the renewable power sector.】

item.title: 暴风雨淹没农作物后，菲律宾为另一场台风做好准备
item.description: 菲律宾将在短短一个多月内遭受第四场暴风雨的侵袭，今年的农作物损失总额至少达 115 亿比索（约合 1.97 亿美元），而且有可能进一步增加。【原文：The Philippines is set to be drenched by its fourth storm in just over a month, which threatens to add to a growing tally of crop losses that total at least 11.5 billion pesos ($197 million) this year.】
